results.title: The Precursors: Cezanne, Gaugin, Van Gogh
results.creator_credit: Danielle Van De Putte, Pierre Alibert, International Film Bureau and Les Films du Cypres
results.brief_description: Portrays the influence of impressionism as exemplified in Cezanne’s preoccupation with construction, Gauguin’s use of descriptive backgrounds and Van Gough’s attempt to evoke emotion rather than display craftsmanship. Narrated by Phillip Gaunt.

results.title: The Practical princess (K)
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, Nick Bosustow and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: When Princess Bedelia was born, the fairies gave her three gifts: beauty, grace and common sense. Her father thinks beautiful princesses don’t need common sense, but Bedelia makes good use of her brains. Based on the book by Jay Williams with animation by Vicente Bassol.

results.title: The Power to fly: the history and development of the flying machine
results.creator_credit: Bob Privett and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: The centuries of trial and error during which man acquired the power to fly. Leonardo da Vinci’s studies of bird flight; Sir George Cayley and the first glider; Stringfellow flies a steam-driven model in 1848; the Wright brothers’ first powered flight in 1903; rapid progress from 1914 to 1918; the passenger carrying biplane; the airplane comes of age; fighter design and high-octane fuels during the Second World War; the jet engine and super sonic flight.

results.title: The Power to change
results.creator_credit: Jamil Simon and Third Eye Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates alternatives to the traditional pattern of production, distribution and use of energy. Focuses on existing projects throughout the Untied Sates, including urban composting, solar energy on the arm, and wind-powered automobiles.

results.title: The Power that means progress, compressed air power
results.creator_credit: Colin Bell, James Carr and British Information Services
results.brief_description: How man uses compressed air power in various situations, from ligh to heavy use. Total information on developing the compressor equipment. Well filmed and edited and the information is well presented in a clear and understandable way.

results.title: The Power pinch
results.creator_credit: Victor Summa, Jane Kaplan and Integrated Video Services
results.brief_description: A documentary which examines sexual harassment of women in the workplace through interviews with women who have experienced sexual harassment and men who discuss their attitudes to the issue. Emphasis is placed on the economic, legal, and emotional ramifications. Explains the underlying causes of such behaviour and shows what all involved parties can do to prevent it. Hosted by Ken Howard.

results.title: The Power of Water
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough, Peter Butt and Film Australia
results.brief_description: We all use electricity in our everyday lives. The Snowy Mountains Hydro Electric Scheme can produce essential peak load for all of New South Wales, Victoria and the Australian Capital Territory within minutes, and water to the Murray and Murrumbidgee irrigation system. “The power of water” looks at the workings and history of the Snowy Mountains Scheme from the early years of construction through to the most recent technological developments. A comprehensive guide on the Scheme introduces the processes which allow Australia’s greatest engineering project to produce a valuable and efficient form of energy - power from water.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chris McCullough, Peter Butt and Film Australia

results.title: The Power of positive influence
results.brief_description: This video training package (with accompanying trainer’s guide) aims to provide managers and team leaders with the skills to assert a positive influence on their team members. As a leader in any situation in any organisation, it is helpful to gain a better understanding of human nature and why people behave in certain ways. While motivation ultimately comes from within, managers can influence what their staff are motivated to do by providing a positive work environment, building confidence and self esteem, and personal empowerment.

results.title: The Power of mentoring
results.brief_description: Mentoring is where an experienced individual invests time, energy and personal knowledge to assist another person. This management title discusses successful mentoring behaviours and follows two main mentoring relationships and their development. Also shown is a mentoring situation which isn’t working, demonstrating that mentoring requires an equal input from both partners. A 51 page training program accompanies this title.
